description: We process billions of unstructured documents every day, globally.We are the industry leader in translating text into profitable decisions; we make state-of-the-art cloud and on-prem text and sentiment analysis technologies that transform customers’ thoughts and conversations into actionable insights.
steps: After registration, you will receive apiKey and apiSecret in account Dashboard https://www.lexalytics.com/users/me/api/keys

blocks.name: getApiStatus
blocks.description: This method retrieves API status information such as the app version, current API version, supported languages and encodings, the overall service status, etc.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

blocks.name: createDocument
blocks.description: This method queues document onto the server for analysis. Queued document analyzes individually and will have its own set of results.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: Identifier of the specific configuration that should be used for processing.

args.name: id
args.info: Up to 32 symbols unique identifier of document assigned and tracked by client.

args.name: text
args.info: Document text that needs to be analyzed by the service.

args.name: tag
args.info: Any text of up to 50 characters used like marker.

blocks.name: createMultipleDocuments
blocks.description: A batch is an array of documents, each which consists of three values: an optional unique ID, an option tag, and the text you wish to analyze.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: documentBody
args.info: A batch is a list of documents that are pushed to the server in one request.

structure.name: id
structure.info: Up to 32 symbols unique identifier of document assigned and tracked by client.

structure.name: text
structure.info: Document text that needs to be analyzed by the service.

structure.name: tag
structure.info: Any text of up to 50 characters used like marker.

args.name: configId
args.info: Identifier of the specific configuration that should be used for processing.

blocks.name: createDocumentsByJobId
blocks.description: A jobId is not required but can be helpful to separate out content processed via particular environments (dev vs QA) or particular job streams (historical content vs live news).Job_id is only supported by the polling method (not callback or auto response) and if you submit via job_id, you must also retrieve by job_id. You can use only 100 unique job_ids per 24 hour period.If you specified a job_id when submitting you must also specify a job_id when retrieving.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: documentBody
args.info: A batch is a list of documents that are pushed to the server in one request.

structure.name: id
structure.info: Up to 32 symbols unique identifier of document assigned and tracked by client.

structure.name: text
structure.info: Document text that needs to be analyzed by the service.

structure.name: tag
structure.info: Any text of up to 50 characters used like marker.

structure.name: jobId
structure.info: If you specified a jobId when submitting you must also specify a jobId when retrieving.

args.name: configId
args.info: Identifier of the specific configuration that should be used for processing.

blocks.name: requestSpecificDocuments
blocks.description: Requesting: Asking the status (or processed results) of a specific document.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: Optional if the document was processed with the default configuration. Required for non-default configurations.

args.name: documentId
args.info: the id of the desired document.

blocks.name: retrieveDocuments
blocks.description: This call retrieves as many processed documents as fit into your maximum batch size.By default, the server responds to retrieval requests with 100 documents per batch. To increase this limit, please contact us.Once a document has been retrieved, it will be removed from the Semantria systems.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: Optional if the document was processed with the default configuration. Required for non-default configurations.

args.name: jobId
args.info: The job id.

blocks.name: cancelDocumentLoad
blocks.description: Deleting a queued document if Semantria has not processed it yet.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: documentId
args.info: the id of the deleted document.

blocks.name: retrieveDocumentsByJobId
blocks.description: If you submitted via jobId, you must also retrieve by that job_id. You cannot use a config_id when retrieving by job_id, although you can use a config_id when submitting with a job_id.This call retrieves as many processed documents as fit into your maximum batch size.By default, the server responds to retrieval requests with 100 documents per batch. To increase this limit, please contact us.Once a document has been retrieved, it will be removed from the Semantria systems.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: jobId
args.info: The job id.

blocks.name: createDocumentMetadata
blocks.description: In addition to the required fields, you can also submit metadata about your content. Metadata submissions are allowed only when using the JSON format of the endpoint. No processing of the metadata elements is done by Semantria and the metadata fields will be returned to you with the document when you retrieve it.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: id
args.info: Up to 32 symbols unique identifier of document assigned and tracked by client.

args.name: tag
args.info: Any text of up to 50 characters used like marker.

args.name: text
args.info: Document text that needs to be analyzed by the service.

args.name: metadata
args.info: The metadata field is schema less and can contain any valid JSON you wish to send. You can attach metadata to individual documents and to collections as well.Example - {"testKey":"testValue"}

blocks.name: createCollectionOfDocuments
blocks.description: This method submits an array of documents to be analyzed in relation to each other and returns one output. Discovery analysis will contain a summary of sentiment, named entity extraction, themes, and categorization for all the documents in the collection.A collection consists of an array of elements: (optional) ID, (optional) tag and an array of pieces of text.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: id
args.info: Up to 32 symbols unique identifier of document assigned and tracked by client.

args.name: tag
args.info: Any text of up to 50 characters used like marker.

args.name: documents
args.info: List of documents text that need to be analyzed by the service.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of config to use.

blocks.name: createCollectionOfDocumentsByJobId
blocks.description: This method submits an array of documents to be analyzed in relation to each other and returns one output. Discovery analysis will contain a summary of sentiment, named entity extraction, themes, and categorization for all the documents in the collection.A collection consists of an array of elements: (optional) ID, (optional) tag and an array of pieces of text.You can use a job_id to separate specific environment (such as dev vs QA). Collections submitted with a job_id must be retrieved via that same job_id.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: id
args.info: Up to 32 symbols unique identifier of document assigned and tracked by client.

args.name: tag
args.info: Any text of up to 50 characters used like marker.

args.name: documents
args.info: List of the simple strings to be processed as collection.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of config to use.

args.name: jobId
args.info: Specific marker of a job collection belongs to, can be used for collections ordering on client side.

blocks.name: retrieveProcessedDiscoveryAnalyses
blocks.description: This method retrieves analysis results for processed collections from Semantria. FAILED collections will have FAILED status in response. Semantria responds with limited amount of results per API call. If configuration ID provided, Semantria responds with the collections, which were queued using the same configuration ID, in opposite Primary configuration uses.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: Return processed documents from a particular config id. If the config_id is not provided, the API uses the primary configuration id by default.

args.name: documentId
args.info: Return only the document with this ID.

blocks.name: retrieveProcessedDiscoveryByJobId
blocks.description: If you submitted by jobId you must also retrieve by jobId.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: jobId
args.info: Return processed documents from a particular job id.

args.name: configId
args.info: Return processed documents from a particular config id. If the config_id is not provided, the API uses the primary configuration id by default.

blocks.name: requestSpecificDiscoveryAnalysis
blocks.description: Requesting: Asking the status (or processed results) of a specific collection.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: collectionId
args.info: The collection id.

args.name: configId
args.info: Return processed documents from a particular config id. If the config_id is not provided, the API uses the primary configuration id by default.

blocks.name: cancelDiscoveryAnalyses
blocks.description: Deleting a queued document if Semantria has not processed it yet.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: collectionId
args.info: The collection id.

blocks.name: getExistingConfigurations
blocks.description: The results listing here shows every settable option in a configuration. You do not have to submit all of these values to modify specific values of a configuration.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

blocks.name: createConfigurations
blocks.description: When creating a configuration, only a few fields are mandatory to set. These are:--name--is_primary--language.The complete list of settable values, their types and defaults, see more in readme.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: name
args.info: Configuration name.

args.name: isPrimary
args.info: Identifies whether the current configuration is primary or not. Default: false.

args.name: autoResponse
args.info: Defines whether or not the service should respond with processed results automatically. Default: false.

args.name: alphanumericThreshold
args.info: Defines the threshold of alphanumeric characters needed in the text in percent. Default: 80.

args.name: conceptTopicsThreshold
args.info: Defines concept topics detection threshold. Default: 0.45.

args.name: oneSentenceMode
args.info: Defines whether or not service should use one sentence mode with less accurate grammar. Default: false.

args.name: processHtml
args.info: Defines whether or not the service should clean up HTML tags before processing. Default: false.

args.name: language
args.info: Defines target language that will be used for task processing. Default: English.

args.name: callback
args.info: Defines a callback URL for automatic data responding.

args.name: modelSentiment
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Switches on/off model-based sentiment feature. Default: false.

args.name: intentions
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Switches on intentions detection feature. Default: false.

args.name: conceptTopics
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether user categories will be reported for the document. Default: false.

args.name: queryTopics
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether queries will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: autoCategories
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether auto-categories will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: namedEntities
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether named entities will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: userEntities
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether user entities will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: themes
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether document and user/named entity themes will be reported for the document. Default: false.

args.name: mentions
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether mentions for themes and user/named entities will be reported for the document. Default: false.

args.name: relations
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether user/named entity relations will be reported for the document. Default: false.

args.name: opinions
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether user/named entity opinions will be reported for the document. Default: false.

args.name: sentimentPhrases
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether sentiment-bearing phrases will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: posTypes
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines parts-of-speech which will be responded by the server.

args.name: summarySize
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Limits the number of sentences for the document summary feature. Default: 3.

args.name: detect_language
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Switches on language detection feature. Default: true.

args.name: collectionFacets
args.info: ConfigurationCollectionSection.Defines whether facets will be reported for the collection. Default: true.

args.name: collectionAttributes
args.info: ConfigurationCollectionSection.Defines whether attributes for facets will be reported for the collection. Default: true.

args.name: collectionMentions
args.info: ConfigurationCollectionSection.Defines whether mentions for themes, user/named entities, facets and attributes will be reported for the collection. Default: false.

args.name: collectionConceptTopics
args.info: ConfigurationCollectionSection.Defines whether user_categories will be reported for the collection. Default: false.

args.name: collectionQueryTopics
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether queries will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: collectionNamedEntities
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether named entities will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: collectionUserEntities
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether user entities will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: collectionThemes
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether document and user/named entity themes will be reported for the document. Default: false.

blocks.name: updateConfigurations
blocks.description: When creating a configuration, only a few fields are mandatory to set. These are:--name--is_primary--language.The complete list of settable values, their types and defaults, see more in readme.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: id
args.info: Enter the ID of the configuration you wish to clone.

args.name: name
args.info: Configuration name.

args.name: isPrimary
args.info: Identifies whether the current configuration is primary or not. Default: false.

args.name: autoResponse
args.info: Defines whether or not the service should respond with processed results automatically. Default: false.

args.name: alphanumericThreshold
args.info: Defines the threshold of alphanumeric characters needed in the text in percent. Default: 80.

args.name: conceptTopicsThreshold
args.info: Defines concept topics detection threshold. Default: 0.45.

args.name: entitiesThreshold
args.info: Defines low threshold for evidence score of named and user entities to be reported in the output. Default: 55.

args.name: oneSentenceMode
args.info: Defines whether or not service should use one sentence mode with less accurate grammar. Default: false.

args.name: processHtml
args.info: Defines whether or not the service should clean up HTML tags before processing. Default: false.

args.name: language
args.info: Defines target language that will be used for task processing. Default: English.

args.name: callback
args.info: Defines a callback URL for automatic data responding.

args.name: modelSentiment
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Switches on/off model-based sentiment feature. Default: false.

args.name: intentions
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Switches on intentions detection feature. Default: false.

args.name: conceptTopics
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether user categories will be reported for the document. Default: false.

args.name: queryTopics
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether queries will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: autoCategories
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether auto-categories will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: namedEntities
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether named entities will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: userEntities
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether user entities will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: themes
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether document and user/named entity themes will be reported for the document. Default: false.

args.name: mentions
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether mentions for themes and user/named entities will be reported for the document. Default: false.

args.name: relations
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether user/named entity relations will be reported for the document. Default: false.

args.name: opinions
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether user/named entity opinions will be reported for the document. Default: false.

args.name: sentimentPhrases
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether sentiment-bearing phrases will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: posTypes
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines parts-of-speech which will be responded by the server.

args.name: summarySize
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Limits the number of sentences for the document summary feature. Default: 3.

args.name: detect_language
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Switches on language detection feature. Default: true.

args.name: collectionFacets
args.info: ConfigurationCollectionSection.Defines whether facets will be reported for the collection. Default: true.

args.name: collectionAttributes
args.info: ConfigurationCollectionSection.Defines whether attributes for facets will be reported for the collection. Default: true

args.name: collectionMentions
args.info: ConfigurationCollectionSection.Defines whether mentions for themes, user/named entities, facets and attributes will be reported for the collection. Default: false.

args.name: collectionConceptTopics
args.info: ConfigurationCollectionSection.Defines whether user_categories will be reported for the collection. Default: false.

args.name: collectionQueryTopics
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether queries will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: collectionNamedEntities
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether named entities will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: collectionUserEntities
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether user entities will be reported for the document. Default: true.

args.name: collectionThemes
args.info: ConfigurationDocumentSection.Defines whether document and user/named entity themes will be reported for the document. Default: false.

blocks.name: cloneConfigurations
blocks.description: This makes an exact copy of an existing configuration.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: template
args.info: Enter the ID of the configuration you wish to clone.

args.name: name
args.info: Name of the new clone.

blocks.name: deleteConfigurations
blocks.description: Send a list of config IDs to be deleted.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: deleteIds
args.info: List of config IDs to be deleted.

blocks.name: getTemplatesList
blocks.description: Get template list.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

blocks.name: getListQueries
blocks.description: Queries are tool to perform precise searches for exact strings or term combination within content. Theyare useful for finding product names, competitor names, specific features, and more. They can also beused for classifying very precise concepts rather than using broad categories.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration you wish to create queries in

blocks.name: createQueries
blocks.description: Pass an object within the body of the request with a param.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration containing queries you wish to list.

args.name: bodyQuery
args.info: Boolean query used for content categorization.

blocks.name: updateQueries
blocks.description: Pass a JSON-encoded object within the body of the request. A list of query, text key and value pairs. The text of the query submitted will replace an existing query.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration containing queries you wish to list.

args.name: bodyQuery
args.info: List of the queries to be update on the server.

blocks.name: deleteQueries
blocks.description: The delete request allows users to remove queries from the server for a specific configuration.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration containing queries you wish to list.

args.name: queryList
args.info: List of query identifiers.

blocks.name: getCategoriesList
blocks.description: Categories are broad tags that the Semantria service intelligently labels content with. Think of them asbuckets into which content is sorted into.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration containing categories you wish to list.

blocks.name: createCategories
blocks.description: The createCategories endpoint allows users to create categories on the server for a specific configuration.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration containing queries you wish to list.

args.name: bodyCategories
args.info: Parameters should be passed within JSON objectList of the categories to be added on the server.

structure.name: weight
structure.info: The “weigh” parameter is a tool that allows users to manually fine tune the impact of certain categories that don’t properly reflect reality.

blocks.name: updateCategories
blocks.description: The updateCategories endpoint allows users to update categories on the server for a specific configuration.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration containing queries you wish to list.

args.name: bodyCategories
args.info: Parameters should be passed within JSON objectList of the categories to be update on the server.Required field - id.

structure.name: weight
structure.info: The “weigh” parameter is a tool that allows users to manually fine tune the impact of certain categories that don’t properly reflect reality.

blocks.name: deleteCategories
blocks.description: This method removes certain user categories by their IDs on Semantria side.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration containing queries you wish to list.

args.name: categoriesList
args.info: Parameters should be passed within JSON objectList of the categories to be deleted from the server.

blocks.name: getListTaxonomy
blocks.description: Lists the existing taxonomy structure for a given config.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration containing queries you wish to list.

blocks.name: createTaxonomy
blocks.description: Crete a new taxonomy in a given config. Each config can have only one taxonomy defined.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of config to create the taxonomy in.

args.name: bodyTaxonomy
args.info: Parameters should be passed within JSON objectList of the taxonomy to be added on the server.Required field - name.

structure.name: enforce_parent_matching
structure.info: Enforces parent nodes to match on a content if the current node matches.

structure.name: nodes
structure.info: The list of sub-nodes associated with the current taxonomy node.

structure.name: topics
structure.info: The list of the topics associated with the current taxonomy node

blocks.name: updateTaxonomy
blocks.description: To add nodes, or add topics to nodes, specify the relationship in the JSON you submit. You must refer to existing topics and nodes by their ID.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of config with taxonomy to update.

args.name: bodyTaxonomy
args.info: Parameters should be passed within JSON objectList of the taxonomy to be update on the server.Required field - id,name.

structure.name: enforce_parent_matching
structure.info: Enforces parent nodes to match on a content if the current node matches.

structure.name: nodes
structure.info: The list of sub-nodes associated with the current taxonomy node.

structure.name: topics
structure.info: The list of the topics associated with the current taxonomy node

blocks.name: deleteTaxonomy
blocks.description: This method removes certain taxonomy nodes by their IDs on Semantria side.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration containing queries you wish to list.

args.name: taxonomyIds
args.info: List of taxonomy node identifiers.

blocks.name: getListSentimentPhrases
blocks.description: This method retrieves list of sentiment-bearing phrases available on Semantria side.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration containing queries you wish to list.

blocks.name: createSentimentPhrases
blocks.description: This method adds sentiment-bearing phrases on Semantria side

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of config to create the taxonomy in.

args.name: bodyPhrase
args.info: List of parametrized objects.

structure.name: weight
structure.info: The `weigh` parameter is a tool that allows users to manually fine tune the impact of certain phrase that don’t properly reflect reality.

blocks.name: updateSentimentPhrases
blocks.description: This method updates sentiment-bearing phrases by unique IDs on Semantria side.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of config to create the taxonomy in.

args.name: bodyPhrase
args.info: List of parametrized objects.

structure.name: weight
structure.info: The `weigh` parameter is a tool that allows users to manually fine tune the impact of certain phrase that don’t properly reflect reality.

blocks.name: deleteSentimentPhrases
blocks.description: This method removes certain sentiment-bearing phrases by their names on Semantria side.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration containing queries you wish to list.

args.name: sentimentPhrasesIds
args.info: List of sentiment-bearing phrase identifiers.

blocks.name: getListEntities
blocks.description: This method retrieves list of user entities available on Semantria side.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration containing entities you wish to list.

blocks.name: createEntities
blocks.description: This method adds user entities on Semantria side.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration you wish to list entities for.

args.name: bodyEntities
args.info: List of parametrized objects.

blocks.name: updateEntities
blocks.description: This method updates user entities by unique IDs on Semantria side.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration you wish to list entities for.

args.name: bodyEntities
args.info: List of parametrized objects.Required field - id.

blocks.name: deleteEntities
blocks.description: This method removes certain user entities by their names on Semantria side.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Your API Secret.

args.name: configId
args.info: ID of configuration containing entities you wish to list.

args.name: entitiesIds
args.info: List of user entity identifiers.

blocks.name: getBlacklist
blocks.description: This method retrieves all backlisted items available on Semantria side.
